sentences.sContent: Maori cannibalism has been stamped out in New Zealand and many (but not all) of the archipelagos to its north.
sentences.sContent_eng: Maori cannibalism has been stamped out in New Zealand and many (but not all) of the archipelagos to its north.
sentences.sCn: 而在新西兰和新西兰以北的大部分群岛上，毛利人的食人陋习已被扑灭。

sentences.sContent: This kiss is also performed by numerous Pacific Islander cultures, including the Maori of New Zealand, where it is a ritual greeting.
sentences.sContent_eng: This kiss is also performed by numerous Pacific Islander cultures, including the Maori of New Zealand, where it is a ritual greeting.
sentences.sCn: 这种亲吻方式也是很多太平洋的岛上居民所采用的，包括新西兰的毛利人，他们就是这样相互问候的。

sentences.sContent: A few lucky survivors, who were able to find a hiding spot inside the mast of the boat, were horrified as they watched the Maori devour their shipmates through the night and in to the next morning.
sentences.sContent_eng: A few lucky survivors, who were able to find a hiding spot inside the mast of the boat, were horrified as they watched the Maori devour their shipmates through the night and in to the next morning.
sentences.sCn: 有极少数的幸存者，有幸躲在船上桅杆里中空的隐藏点，逃过一劫，目睹了令人毛骨悚然的一幕：他们同船的伙伴被这些毛利人在当夜及第二天早上大口大口地吃掉。

trans.tranOther: someone who belongs to the race of people that first lived in New Zealand and now forms only a small part of the population
